direction.raw_text: Family and friends are leaving the wake, exiting the softly-lit chapel into a snowy night.  They are saying goodbyes, kissing one another, going to their cars.  And saying her last goodbye... ...Rachel turns to Luke.  Whispers, close to his ear.  He looks at her for a beat, then leads Annabelle and Ben toward the car, as... Rachel goes back into the chapel.  Alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is nearly dark.  One soft spot plays on a simple CASKET. No canned organ music, no sound at all.  As Rachel enters. She goes to the casket.  Stares down at it for a beat.  And just above a whisper...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, I told you I'd do this. Only...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only.  Now I don't know what to say. Her hand reaches out.  A finger absently traces the edge of the wood.  It seems a gesture of unconscious affection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'd have written it down, so you wouldn't blow it. A slight smile.  Here's where the love shows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should change places. Nods slightly.  Maybe we should.  She takes a step back now, to a waiting chair. Sits.  Her hands folded in her lap.  Thinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well.  We were less than friends, I guess.  And more. More.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were never...girlfriends, we never dished.  That wasn't.  What we had. No apology there.  It's just the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had some battles, man, they were...world class, huh? (beat) And I don't regret a one of them. Sad little shrug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss them. Thinking.  Of how much more she'll miss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got our secrets, we have. And I'll keep 'em if you will. Crosses her arms.  Lost in the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I wish we had one more night. In that little bar, remember? Remember that toast?  Sure, you do. Her voice wavers.  But the eyes are dry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know what?  I forgive me, too. See? You're the magician. A murmur...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, partner, I've got your back.  We're covered. It's what she came to say.  CROSSFADE TO...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lights and music and laughter.  They're in black tie tonight.  It's a wedding party.  Up on the stage, at the head table, some guy is finishing a toast, and as everyone ROARS and CLAPS...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...so TO THE BRIDE!  Thank GOD she's more than he deserves! Everybody shouts THE BRIDE.  Everybody drinks champagne. And the bride stands up. In her white gown.  In her hand, an envelope.  She goes to the mike, and waits for the raucous cheers, the calls of SPEECH!, to die down. Leans to the mike.  Flushed and happy.  And, oddly, nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I know the tradition, so this isn't a toast.  At least... not for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guest list is 114.  But we all know there's one more here, tonight.  Because... Looks down the table at her children.  Dressed to kill.  Enjoying the party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...my two sidekicks there always bring her along.  Wherever they go. Right?  Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Jackie and I were sitting around.  On New Year's Eve.  And she said, 'You're not gonna talk at my funeral, are you?' And now.  It is quiet indeed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I said, 'I've never been to a funeral.  I'm not sure I'll know how to act...' Her sweet smile.  Keeps the mood right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...but I'll prob'ly sneak into where you are.  Just before it's over...' Nods to herself.  Fights back the feeling of that moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...say something.  Just to you. Get the last word in, when you can't talk back.' There is laughter in this room.  Gentle, loving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So she says, 'No way.' Holds up the envelope.  Holds it tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wrote this.  She sealed it up, I didn't see it.  She made me promise to read it.  At the wedding. And slowly, Luke begins to CLAP.  And others join.  And when it stops...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told her she'd better make it dirty, or make it funny.  Because... no way...on my wedding... No way in hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...could she make me cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  They are loving it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She says, 'It's a deal'. The band plays an impromptu FLOURISH.  Rachel begins to carefully tear open the envelope...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, if it's too raunchy, we may have to excuse the kids...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from everyone, ESPECIALLY the children. She has it open.  She looks at it. And everything.  Stops. The world watches her sway, watches her eyes fill as she stares at the small card in her hand.  She can't believe this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You promised. The tears are welling.  Everyone SCREAMS for her to read it.  She leans to the mike, shaking her head...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's...no big thing, really... it's just...five words, it's... The place goes happily UP FOR GRABS.  A joyful RIOT of demand. Tears STREAMING now, Rachel fumbles to pull up her white beaded bag.  As she puts the card inside, we alone can read the words...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  ARE SO LUCKY.
direction.name: direction
